item.itunes:title: Elijah, John the Baptist, Jesus and the Kingdom
item.itunes:summary: In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul takes us on a journey through the Word, teaching on the relationship between Elijah, John and Jesus and what each of them represent to us under the New Covenant of grace. Wednesday evening Bible study from November 30, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 30, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about the importance of believing and confessing that we are who the Bible says we are.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 29, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about the power we have to see what is ours in the spiritual realm also manifest itself in the physical.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 28, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about focusing on the higher truth of who we are in Christ instead of focusing on what we see all around us.

item.itunes:title: Necessary Equipment in a World That is Not Your Home
item.itunes:summary: In this sermon, Pastor Paul takes us to 1 John, urging us not to govern ourselves by what we see, hear and feel, but rather to allow the Holy Spirit inside of us to guide and teach us through His gentle voice. Sunday sermon from November 27, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 27, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about the importance of seeing ourselves the same way God sees us.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 26, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul encourages us to just lean on Christ who is in us, the hope of glory.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 25, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul continues to talk about Christ in us, the hope of glory, focusing today on how God is constantly building our character.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 24, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about how sometimes we can render Christ in us (the hope of glory), ineffective in our lives.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 23, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul discusses the topic of hope and what it means to have Christ in us, the hope of glory.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 22, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about what it means to for us to be ambassadors of Christ to the world.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 21, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul introduces the topic of the "ministry of reconciliation".

item.itunes:title: What is Friendship With the World?
item.itunes:summary: If it's impossible to be a friend of the world and a friend of God at the same time, than what does it mean to be worldly? In this sermon, Pastor Paul sheds light on this crucial topic, teaching what it means to be worldly according to the New Covenant of grace. Sunday service from November 20, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 20, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about how we are called by God and what we are called to do.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 19, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul continues to talk about how God disciplines us.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 18, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul continues to discuss the crucial difference between God's punishment and God's discipline.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 17, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul introduces the crucial difference between God's punishment and God's discipline.

item.itunes:title: Faith + Works = Oil & Water
item.itunes:summary: Can faith and works co-exist? How can we enjoy complete freedom in Christ? In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul answers these questions, teaching that our faith is not to elicit a response from God but rather our faith is our response to Christ's finished work. Wednesday evening Bible study from November 16, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 16, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about the importance of allowing Christ to live through us and what it means to live according to the law of liberty.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 15, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about how to spot legalism in our every day lives.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 14, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul takes us to 2 Peter 3:17, teaching on how to maintain the balance between grace and faith and how to identify legalism.

item.itunes:title: Settle For Nothing Less Than 'Free Indeed'
item.itunes:summary: Is it possible for a believer to never sin again? Can we be 100% free? What does it mean to be free in Christ? In this sermon, Pastor Paul answers these questions, teaching that we are not simply set free from sin and the law but we have been freed to live free indeed, as sons and daughters and not slaves. Sunday service from November 13, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:summary: On today's podcast, Pastor Paul talks about the writings of the Apostle Paul and what it means to live by a "higher law".

item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to Isaiah 52:14 and 53:5, continuing the topic of communion, and teaching on how communion declares that Jesus bore all of our sicknesses in His body.

item.itunes:title: If the Work is Finished, How Should I Pray?
item.itunes:summary: If we are beloved sons and daughters of God and joint heirs with Christ of all things, then how should we pray? On this Bible study message, Pastor Paul answers this crucial question, teaching on how we should approach prayer in light of the New Covenant of grace. Wednesday evening Bible study from November 9, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 11, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to 1 Corinthians 11:24-25, continuing the topic of communion, and teaching on how communion declares that the same way God protected Jesus, He will also protect you.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 10, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to John 6:66, continuing the topic of communion, and teaching on what you are saying when you partake in the communion.

item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to Romans 3:26 and Romans 4:5, continuing the topic of communion, and teaching on the true meaning of the covenant meal.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 8, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to Exodus 24: 9-11, continuing on the topic of communion and teaching on how we are only in covenant with God because of Christ.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 7, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul introduces the topic of communion, teaching on how communion is covenant language.

item.itunes:title: Appropriating Covenant Through the Power of Communion
item.itunes:summary: What is the significance of communion? What is the relationship between communion and God's promises for us? In this sermon, Pastor Paul establishes that communion is much more than a ceremony; it's a vital covenant that confirms our right standing in Christ as sons and daughters of God. Sunday service from November 6, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 6, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul introduces the topic of communion, teaching on its meaning and importance.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 5, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to Hebrews 1:14, continuing on the topic of God's down payment and teaching on how all of God's blessings aren't payments or rewards but rather part of our inheritance in Christ.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 4, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to 2 Corinthians 5:5, continuing on the topic of God's down payment and teaching on what that means in relation to the future promises of God.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 3, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to Romans 8:5,6 continuing on the topic of God's down payment and teaching on what it means to be "spiritually minded".

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Podcast- November 2, 2011
item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to 2 Corinthians 1:17-22, continuing on the topic of God's down payment and teaching on how we now live from the point of victory, having security from the enemy.

item.itunes:summary: On today's program, Pastor Paul takes us to 2 Corinthians 1:17-22, introducing the topic of God's down payment.

item.itunes:summary: How can we identify legalism in our lives? How can we live in true righteousness, free from legalism? In this sermon, Pastor Paul answers these questions, teaching that our greatest testimony is not how we live, but the way we love one another, free from the motivations of legalism. Sunday service from October 30, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:summary: Today Pastor Paul continues to teach on core verses in the message of radical grace. Today's verses are Malachi 4:5-6 and Revelation 22:21, as we look at the contrast between closing verses in the old and new testaments.

item.itunes:title: Remind God of His Covenant
item.itunes:summary: In this crucial sermon, Pastor Paul teaches that in the same way the rainbow reminded God never to flood the Earth again, when we partake in the communion, we not only believe for our healing, but remind God of His eternal covenant of peace and of Christ's perfect, finished work. Sunday service from March 6, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at: www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 4, 2011
item.itunes:summary: Is God good to us because of our consecration, or because He honors Christ's finished work at the cross? In today's program, we will air the conclusion to a Bible study message titled "Living in the Blessings of Deuteronomy 28". In it, Pastor Paul teaches that because Jesus' obedience at the cross, if we are in Him, we are Abraham's seed and thus qualified to receive all the blessings of Deuteronomy 28. Part 5 of 5.

Likewise, we are also the lights of the world and a representation of Jesus on this Earth. Wednesday evening Bible study from March 2, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

Part 5 of 5.

item.itunes:title: Let Nothing Keep You From the Supper
item.itunes:summary: How do we reconcile the message of grace to what we have been taught in the past? From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 17, 2011
item.itunes:summary: In today's program, we will air Part 4 of a Bible Study message titled "The Problem With The Old Covenant and How God Solved It". Why did we need the New Covenant of grace? Was there anything wrong with the Old Covenant of the law? In tonight's Bible study message, Pastor Paul goes deeper into the issues with the Old Covenant, teaching that God is just when He doesn't judge us for our sins, but instead is satisfied with the ultimate sacrifice of His Son at the cross.

From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Loveliness of Jesus
item.itunes:summary: How can we see Jesus as lovely in the Bible? Why and how does God deal with us differently under the New Covenant of grace? item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- January 28, 2011
item.itunes:summary: In today's program we will air the conclusion to a Bible study message titled "Feed On Jesus’ Death & You Will Show Forth His Life". What is the message of the "finished work"? How can the finished work go to work in our lives without any works of our own? In this message, Pastor Paul teaches that faith activates the flood of grace in our lives, and that we can only fall from grace when we rely on our own works instead of His finished work.

item.itunes:title: Restraint or Real Change?
item.itunes:summary: Do we live by will power and self control, or is there real change that takes place when we are born again? What does it mean to live for God in light of the message of grace? In this Bibles study message, Pastor Paul continues on the Book of Revelation, answering these important questions and teaching on the church of Philadelphia. Wednesday evening Bible study from January 26, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Free to Marry Another
item.itunes:summary: What is spiritual adultery? How did Jesus’ death affect our relationship with the law? In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul takes us to the church of Thyatira in Revelation, teaching on our freedom from performance based Christianity and an Old Covenant mentality. Wednesday service from January 12, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

item.itunes:title: Disarming the Darkness
item.itunes:summary: What did Jesus accomplish at the cross in regards to our relationship with the law? What is the weapon the enemy uses to this day to make us feel guilty and condemned? In this message, Pastor Paul teaches that the enemy has already been disarmed by Jesus but there's a weapon we sometimes hand over to him. Sunday service from January 9, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: From Faith to Faith
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to receive revelation? What happens to our faith when Jesus is lifted up and presented as lovely? in this Bible study message, Pastor Paul teaches that revelation should always build you up and point you to Jesus, and that when we are saved out of fear and judgment, we serve Him the same way. Wednesday evening Bible study from January 5, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: No Condemnation; No Separation; No Accusation
item.itunes:summary: In this sermon, Pastor Paul preaches a foundational message of the New Covenant of Grace, teaching that Jesus bore all of our condemnation, that He bridged the gap between God and man, reconciling the world back to Him and thus we can never be accused! Sunday service from January 2, 2011. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Gone With the Wind
item.itunes:summary: In this sermon, Pastor Paul presents some amazing truths regarding the relationship between the New Covenant and Pentecost, teaching that the Old Covenant of trying to achieve righteousness by our works was gone with the wind of Pentecost. New Year's Eve service from December 31, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Search for Pure Religion
item.itunes:summary: What is the "pure religion" mentioned in the Book of James? What is the role of external works in the message of grace? In this sermon, Pastor Paul answers these questions, showing us that the distance between us and God has been eliminated forever by Jesus, and that we are no longer orphans and widows. Sunday service from December 5, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- December 3, 2010
item.itunes:summary: In today's program we will air the conclusion to a classic Bible study message titled "The Fellowship of the Mystery". Why did Jesus often speak in parables? item.itunes:title: It is Finished: The Story of Ananias and Sapphira
item.itunes:summary: If God judged the sins of the world in the body of Jesus on the cross, then why do Ananias and Sapphira die when they sin in Acts 5? In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul answers this question, teaching on the relationship between Jesus' finished work at the cross and God's judgment. Wednesday evening Bible study from December 1, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org.

Sunday service from November 14, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

In this sermon, Pastor Paul teaches that when we allow the righteousness that dwells in us to come out, we profit our Spirit-life and as a consequence our physical life. Sunday service from October 31, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. To order this sermon on audio CD, visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org

item.itunes:summary: What is the law of restitution an how is it relevant to us today? Why can we confidently expect good things to happen to us? item.itunes:title: "Today" is Your Day of Rest

item.itunes:title: How to Know, Beyond a Shadow of a Doubt, That You Are Saved
item.itunes:summary: Can we rely on our feelings in order to know that we are saved? Does God remember our sins? In this important message, Pastor Paul answers these crucial questions, teaching that in order to rest assured of our salvation, our witness must match the witness of the Holy Spirit, resting in the knowledge that our sins are not counted against us. Sunday service from September 19, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. Visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org to order a copy of this sermon on audio CD.

item.itunes:title: Truth in the Midst of Trouble
item.itunes:summary: How can we make it through tough times? How can we learn to deal with our problems by seeing how Jesus operated in the midst of trouble? In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul teaches that the key to getting through difficult times is to start seeing God for who He is and our troubles as opportunities to bring glory to His name, all the while knowing just how loved we are. Wednesday evening Bible study from September 15, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

In this message, Pastor Paul answers these and other questions in a timely message.

In this message, Pastor Paul answers these and other questions in a timely message.

item.itunes:title: FAITH: The Title Deed to Answered Prayer

In this message, Pastor Paul teaches on the importance of placing our faith in Jesus' finished work at the cross and what happens when we do that. Sunday service from September 12, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

Wednesday evening study from September 8, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

In this message, Pastor Paul answers these and other questions in a timely message.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- September 9, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What exactly did the Apostle Paul preach and what can we learn from him? Pastor Paul White tackles this and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 15th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- September 8, 2010
item.itunes:summary: How can Jesus give us rest? What is this rest from and why do we need it? How can we counsel one another? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 15th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:summary: In today's program we will air a recent message titled "Life in the Promised Land" (Part 2). How can we avoid confusion, instability and unrest in our lives? item.itunes:summary: How can we produce fruit effortlessly? Does God need our help in order to change us? Pastor Paul preaches from a parable unique to the Book of Mark, teaching some vital truths about our spiritual growth. Sunday service from September 5, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri. Visit www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org to order a copy on CD.

item.itunes:title: Rest, Perfection and Grace Found in the Final Prayer of Jesus
item.itunes:summary: This in-depth journey through John 17 shows us 7 petitions of Jesus (rest), 7 gifts of God (perfection) and 5 works of grace…and all in one prayer! Wednesday evening Bible study from September 1, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Speak to the Smitten Rock: Water for the Thirsty Soul
item.itunes:summary: How can we enjoy living water in our lives? Is our salvation a finished work or is our obedience required in order to complete it? Sunday service from August 29, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:summary: If we have a new heart in Christ, what are the contents of that heart? What is the role of grace in the Bible? item.itunes:title: The Greatest Commandment
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to love God with all our heart, soul and mind? Is it really possible to love our neighbors like we love ourselves? In today's sermon, Pastor Paul teaches that under the New Covenant, God's love is greater than all of our actions and it's handed to us free through Jesus' sacrifice and that when we understand how loved we are, we can love others free of any guilt or condemnation. Sunday service from March 28, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Grace and Peace Multiplied
item.itunes:summary: How can we see grace and peace multiplied in our lives? Is there anything that we can do to stunt this multiplication? In this sermon, Pastor Paul urges us to stop seeing God as being mad at us, instead resting in the fact that the war is over, with Jesus having been victorious over sin and death forever. Sunday service from March 14, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast - March 26, 2010
item.itunes:summary: Intoday's program we will airPart 2 of a recent Bible study message titled: "The Church:An Agent for Social Change or Heart Change?" In itPastor Paul takes a closer look at what should be the role of the church.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast - March 25, 2010
item.itunes:summary: Does the world have the right to executejudgment on people that break the law? Pastor Paul White tackles this and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 13th chapter of the Book of Romans. At the end of today's program we will air Part 1 ofa recent sermon titled: "The Church: An Agent for Social Change or Heart Change?"

item.itunes:title: The Problem With The Old Covenant and How God Solved It
item.itunes:summary: Why did we need the New Covenant of grace? Was there anything wrong with the Old Covenant of the law? In tonight's Bible study message, Pastor Paul goes deeper into the issues with the Old Covenant, teaching that God is just when He doesn't judge us for our sins, but instead is satisfied with the ultimate sacrifice of His Son at the cross. Wednesday evening Bible study from March 24, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast - March 24, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What has the church done, and continues to do,to bring persecution upon itself? What is the difference between preaching Jesus and being "preachy"? Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 13th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast - March 23, 2010
item.itunes:summary: When thingsgo against the church, is it always the work of the enemy?What is the difference between being persecuted for Christ's sakeand for our own sake? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 13th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast - March 22, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What should be the Christian's relationship with our local governments? Why is it so important to understand the difference between using the law to maintain order and using it to achieve righteousness? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 13th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Never Look Back
item.itunes:summary: In today's message, Pastor Paul urges us never again to be reminded of our failures and to leave behind the erroneous idea that God is still judging sin. Instead we should look forward to Jesus, in whom we find abundant hope, peace, grace and favor, resting confidently in the fact that all our past, present and future sins have been judged in His body once and for all. Sunday service from March 21, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 19, 2010
item.itunes:summary: How should a Christian handle being wronged by an unbeliever? Is war ever justifiable? Is it wrong to be angry? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 18, 2010
item.itunes:summary: Why do so many people have the erroneous idea that God moves based on our perseverance? How should we pray under the new covenant of God's grace? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: The Call to Liberty is a Revolution, Not a Rebellion
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study message, Pastor Paul focuses on Christian liberty and responsibility, teaching that a true grace revolution will take the spotlight away from us and into the amazing loveliness of Jesus. Wednesday evening Bible study from March 17, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 17, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean for us to live with a constant expectation of good? How can we know we should live that way, as opposed to having a constant expectation of judgment? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 16, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What does it mean to "love without hypocrisy"? Why is it so important to focus on how much God loves us, instead of how much love we have for Him? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 15, 2010
item.itunes:summary: In today's edition of our program we will air a sample of the soon to be available "Five Women of Grace" series on audio CD. Visit us at www.PaulWhiteMinistries.org to reserve your copy today!

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 12, 2010
item.itunes:summary: Throughout this week we will air a recent Bible study message titled "How Jesus Makes You See and How Self Makes You Blind". In it, Pastor Paul teaches that when we see our own efforts we are blinded to His goodness, while when we focus on Jesus and His grace we are in turn blinded from the attacks of the enemy. Part 5/Conclusion.

item.itunes:title: Why God Like David (Classic Sermon)
item.itunes:summary: In this sermon from 2008, Pastor Paul takes a closer look at the life of King David. Why was he liked by God and what lessons can we learn from his story about God's grace? From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- March 4, 2010
item.itunes:summary: How does Satan use the law and subsequent condemnation to accuse us? In this recent Bible study message titled "If I Am Not Condemned, How Can I Be Accused?", Pastor Paul White teaches us that the enemy’s job is to constantly accuse us, but we have an Advocate in Jesus who has redeemed us from condemnation. Part 6/Conclusion.

item.itunes:title: Feed On Jesus' Death & You Will Show Forth His Life
item.itunes:summary: What is the message of the "finished work"? How can the finished work go to work in our lives without any works of our own? In tonight's Bible study message, Pastor Paul teaches that faith activates the flood of grace in our lives, and that we can only fall from grace when we rely on our own works instead of His finished work. Wednesday evening Bible study from March 3, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 24, 2010
item.itunes:summary: If we don't understand who we are in Christ, how can we reflect the Christ that dwells inside of us to the outside world? What is the relationship between doubt and condemnation? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 23, 2010
item.itunes:summary: Is there anything we can do to avoid being conformed to this world? What is the main role of the Holy Spirit in the life of the believer? Why is it so vital for us to change the way we think about ourselves? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:summary: Why is it so crucial for us to realize we are made righteous by faith? What does it mean to "yield our bodies as living sacrifices"? How does that relate to our sanctification? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the 12th chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: Be Sure To Feed On The Right Bread
item.itunes:summary: In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul urges us to stop seeing all our problems, sorrows and worries in ourselves and instead start seeing them in Jesus, feeding on the bread of life. Wednesday evening Bible study from February 17, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, MO.

item.itunes:title: Wake Up to Righteousness (Classic Sermon)
item.itunes:summary: How should we deal with Christians who struggle with various sins? In this classic sermon from 2008, Pastor Paul teaches on the relationship between His grace and righteousness and our total victory over sin. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 19, 2010
item.itunes:summary: In today's program we conclude a recent sermon titled "You Are Greatly Blessed, Highly Favored and Deeply Loved". In it Pastor Paul delves deeper into why we can boldly confess that, taking it from a mantra we repeat to a lifestyle we live, through the great price Christ paid at the cross.

item.itunes:title: The Scripture That Changed My Life (Classic Sermon)
item.itunes:summary: Everyone who begins to walk in the freedom of God's abundant grace can point to that moment or to that scripture that sparked a revolution in their spirit. Pastor Paul White takes us to the chapter and the verse that sparked many questions in his heart, and led him on a journey towards the New Covenant. This is classic sermon taken from the Abundant Grace Campmeeting in 2008, from Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 12, 2010
item.itunes:summary: In today's program we bring you the conclusion of a recent Bible study message titled "A Tale of Two Doctrines". In in, Pastor Paul contrasts the doctrines of sin unto death and obedience unto righteousness, teaching that we are made righteous and enjoy all His blessings because of Jesus’ obedience, not ours.

item.itunes:summary: What characterizes the message of radical grace? How can we know if are still living under the law? How can we convince Jewish people that Jesus is who He says He is? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the eleventh chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: The God of the Mountains (Classic Sermon)
item.itunes:summary: In this Bible study message from February 2009, Pastor Paul White starts in the book of Obadiah, teaching on the Mount of Esau, the Holy Mountain and Mount Zion. Understanding the difference between these mountains will teach us a valuable lesson on the fundamental differences between law and grace. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- February 4, 2010
item.itunes:summary: In this week's program we will bring you a recent Wednesday evening Bible study message titled "An Old Testament Parable". In it Pastor Paul teaches on the parable of the four trees of Judges 9:7-15. What is the spiritual meaning behind the olive tree, fig tree, the vine and the bramble, and how does it relate today to the message of grace? Part 4.

item.itunes:title: The Church of the Elder Brother
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study message, Pastor Paul White takes a closer look at the elder brother in the story of the prodigal son. What does much of the church of today have in common with the elder son? Why can we trace back much of our problems to an erroneous view of our Father? Wednesday evening Bible study from February 3, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: High Favor: Success as a Shield
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul teaches that every blessing comes from God and He gives freely because of Jesus, not because of our obedience or good works. When we know Him who is successful, His success, goodness and mercy chases after us. Sunday service from January 24, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Power of the Exchanged Life (Classic Sermon)
item.itunes:summary: In this classic sermon from 2008, Pastor Paul teaches that when a sinner accepts Christ, they not only receive forgiveness of sins, but they exchange their old life for His new one. The exchange that Jesus offers provides life and relationship, and the promise that He will live His life through us by showing His abundant grace and favor. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- January 21, 2010
item.itunes:summary: What causes someone to cut off from Christ, breaking the law or unbelief? When will the Gospel message turn back to the Jews? What is the goodness of God? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the eleventh chapter of the Book of Romans.

Sunday service from January 17, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

Part 5/Conclusion.

Wednesday evening Bible study from January 13, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:summary: What does the communion represent and why is it so important? In today's message, Pastor Paul White preaches on how we can have wholeness of body, mind and spirit through the communion. Sunday service from January 3, 2010. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Self-Examination of the Saint
item.itunes:summary: According to 2 Corinthians 13:5 we are to "examine yourselves, whether you be in the faith". In light of the fact that we are the righteousness of God in Christ, what does that verse mean and what can we learn about how God views us? In this sermon, Pastor Paul White answers these and other important questions. Sunday service from December 27, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, MO.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- December 31, 2009
item.itunes:summary: In this week's program we will air one of the most requested sermons of 2009: "The Believer's Guide to Loving God and Man". In it Pastor Paul teaches that they key to loving God and man is to accept God's love for us and to continually walk in his abundant grace, allowing it to minister love and favor in our lives. Part 4.

Wednesday evening Bible study from December 30, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the tenth chapter of the Book of Romans.

item.itunes:title: The Good Gifts of God
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul teaches that God is so good He gives all good gifts to us liberally, with no strings attached, seeing us forever as righteous apart from our works. When we see Satan attacking us we can rest assured God's grace, favor and provision will always super abound in our lives. Sunday service from December 20, 2009. Part 5/Conclusion.

Sunday morning service from December 13, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, MO.

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- October 6, 2009
item.itunes:summary: What happens when the believer is constantly conscious of sin? If the blood of Jesus purged sins once and for all, why would the believer need to be conscious of sin? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other important questions as he continues a study, now in the ninth chapter of the Book of Romans.

Wednesday evening Bible study from September 30. 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: See Your Sickness and Your Sin in Jesus

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- October 2, 2009

item.itunes:title: Deeper Daily Broadcast- October 1, 2009

Sunday service from September 27, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Living By the Spirit, Not By the Letter
item.itunes:summary: In tonight’s Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches on the blessings, prosperity and peace we can experience when we live according to the Spirit and not according to the letter of the law. Wednesday evening Bible study from September 23, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Supernatural Provision in a Natural World
item.itunes:summary: If we see His provision even in the beauty of the natural world, how much more does God provide for HIs children? In tonight's sermon, Pastor Paul White teaches on God's abundant provision. Sunday evening service from September 20, 2001. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Maintain Your Confession: I Am the Righteousness of God in Christ
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White teaches that there's great power in the tongue and that we are not necessarily what we say but we need to confess who we are in Christ. Sunday morning service from September 20, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Only Thing That We Have to Fear
item.itunes:summary: As a Christian, is there anything we need to fear? In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches that we should rid ourselves of the idea of having to work for our righteousness and anything that reminds us of our sins, while resting in Christ. Wednesday evening Bible study from September 16, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Pulling Down Satanic Strongholds Against Grace
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White teaches on how Satan undermines the message of grace and what we can do to remained focused on Christ's finished work at the cross. Sunday morning service from September 13, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: New Covenant Healing
item.itunes:summary: In today's message, Pastor Paul White teaches that at the cross Jesus put all our sins and our sickness in His body, having bore the deep bruise so we wouldn't bear the deep sin. Sunday morning service from September 6, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: More Holiness By God's Grace
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches that Christianity is not about behavior modification but rather a relationship with Christ that will eventually change our behavior and also that the only personal responsibility of the believer when it comes to holiness is for us to believe that the finished work of Christ is truly finished and not let our heart condemn us. Wednesday evening Bible study from September 2, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Power of Saying 'Amen!'
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White takes us on a journey through the Bible, teaching on the meaning and power of saying 'Amen' and the importance of lining up what we think of ourselves to what God thinks of us. Sunday service from August 30, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: How to Produce True Holiness
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches that we can't make ourselves any more holy than what Christ has made us at the cross and that the more self righteous we are, the less we see of Jesus. Wednesday evening Bible study from August 26, 2009. from Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Believers Lose Their Rest in the Lap of Delilah
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White preaches out of the Book of Judges, taking the story of Samson and Delilah to teach us some crucial truths regarding covenant and the importance of resting in Christ's finished work, regardless of our circumstances. Sunday service from August 23, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Grace Gets Better Results
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches that grace empowers us to do great things and that we will get better results with less effort under grace than we ever did putting up maximum effort under the law. Wednesday evening Bible study from August 19, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: The Source of Our Salvation
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White teaches that the source of all our peace, prosperity, health, rest, wholeness and salvation is Jesus Christ, who suffered in order to give us peace that surpasses all understanding. Sunday service from August 9, 2009. From MIdland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Don't Cast Off Your Confidence
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White preaches that when we know how loved we are by God, we are confident and come boldly to His throne. Sunday service from August 2, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Finding God's Identity in the Still, Small Voice
item.itunes:summary: Sunday service from July 26, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Reaping What You Sow is Not You Being Judged For Sin
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White takes a closer look at the law of sowing and reaping, explaining the righteous judgment of God under the new covenant of God's abundant grace. Sunday service from July 19, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Forgiveness: Removing Satan's Advantage Over the Saint
item.itunes:summary: What is the role of the Holy Spirit in the believer's life? Why is it important to forgive? Pastor Paul White tackles these and other questions in today's sermons. Sunday service from July 12, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: There's a Whole Lot of People Going Home
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White takes a closer look at various verses that deal with eternal life, exposing some common misinterpretations and answering the question of why many people will be going to Heaven. Sunday service from June 28, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Set Free From the Snare of the Devil by Times of Refreshing
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White preaches that when we see ourselves as unrighteous, while God sees us as righteous; and when we try to live the law, we hand over to the devil the only weapon that he has against the believer -- condemnation. All the while the believer can find refreshing when we feed on His loviliness and spend time in His presence. Sunday service from June 21, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: How to Destroy Your Faith
item.itunes:summary: In this Bible study message, Pastor Paul White teaches that there's nothing we can do to earn God's grace, as faith does not require any work from us. Wednesday evening Bible study from June 10, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Can't Get No Satisfaction
item.itunes:summary: In today's message Pastor Paul White teaches that it's crucial for believers to understand that God is satisfied with them, not because of their good works, but because of Christ's perfect work at the cross. When we grasp His amazing love for us, we feel satisfied because we know He is satisfied. Sunday service from June 7, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Maintaining Vision in Times of Dryness
item.itunes:summary: How do we feed our soul on God's abundant grace in the midst of trials and tribulations? How do we keep our focus on Christ's finished work despite all the distractions in our lives? Pastor Paul answers these and other questions in tonight's Bible study. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Stop Dreaming and Start Living
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White urges us to stop seeing victory as something that is always ahead of us, and live the abundant life Christ promised us NOW. Also, under law God is distanced from man because of his failures, while Grace will always come to us freely, based on Christ's finished work at the cross. Sunday service from May 31, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Examine Yourself in the Faith
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White teaches from 2 Corinthians 13:5, a verse that is often preached incorrectly as a call for believers to constantly question their salvation. What did the Apostle Paul mean by "examine yourselves"? Wednesday evening Bible study from May 20, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Avoiding Offence in a World of Offences
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White preaches an important message, warning us not to use all the freedom that we have living under grace to become a stumbling block to others through our actions. Sunday service from May 17, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: How to Reign in This Life
item.itunes:summary: In tonight's Bible study, Pastor Paul White takes his title from Romans 5:17, teaching that in order for believers to reign in this life, we first need to receive abundance of grace and open the gift of righteousness. Wednesday evening Bible study from May 13, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: What is Means to be Separate From Sinners
item.itunes:summary: In today's message Pastor Paul White examines a number of scriptures that are often misquoted or taken out of context, teaching that we as believers get the blessings that were supposed to be be Christ's for keeping the law, while He took the curse that we deserved for breaking the law. Sunday service from May 10, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.

item.itunes:title: Protection From the Cares of This Life
item.itunes:summary: In today's sermon, Pastor Paul White preaches a timely message that urges believers, despite the difficult times and the negative news all around us, to simply focus our eyes on Jesus and the Holy Spirit will be our rear guard. Sunday service from May 3, 2009. From Midland Church in Poplar Bluff, Missouri.
